Class Meter

Namespace
Flex.Smoothlake.FlexLib
Assembly
FlexLib.dll

Represents a telemetry meter that provides real-time monitoring data from the radio.

public class Meter
Inheritance
object
Meter
Inherited Members
object.Equals(object)
object.Equals(object, object)

object.ReferenceEquals(object, object)

Examples

// Monitor SWR during transmission
radio.MeterAdded += (meter) =>
{
    if (meter.Name == "SWR")
    {
        meter.DataReady += (data) =>
        {
            Console.WriteLine($"SWR: {data.Value:F2}:1");

            if (data.Value > 3.0)
            {
                Console.WriteLine("WARNING: High SWR detected!");
            }
        };
    }
};

Remarks

Meters provide real-time monitoring of various radio parameters including:

  • Signal levels (MICPEAK, COMPPEAK, SIGNAL)
  • Power measurements (FWD, REF, SWR)
  • System status (VOLTAGE, TEMP)
  • Audio levels (LEVELPEAK, LEVELAVG)

Meters are automatically created by the radio and added to the Radio.MeterList. Subscribe to the Radio.MeterAdded event to be notified when new meters become available, then subscribe to the meter's DataReady event to receive real-time data updates.

Meter data updates are sent at regular intervals (typically 10-50ms depending on the meter type). Event handlers are called on a background thread.
